com.caratage.lib

Class MatrixOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caratage.lib.MatrixOperations

  • public class MatrixOperations
extends java.lang.Object

    Matrix Operations

    Collection of methods from EidiP for BIS at HBRS.

    Note: These are exemplary methods for n x n matrix operations. We only look at the logic of swapping cells here. A new array is produced and returned.

    Since:
    2017-01-24
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Urs Weishaupt (uweish2s)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MatrixOperations() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[][] diagonalDown(int[][] f)
      Mirror a matrix at diagonale left-top to right-bottom (transpose) and return matrix in a new array.
      static int[][] diagonalUp(int[][] f)
      Mirror a matrix at diagonale left-bottom to right-top and return matrix in a new array.
      static int[][] flipHorizontal(int[][] f)
      Flip matrix horizontally and return matrix in a new array.
      static int[][] flipVertical(int[][] f)
      Flip matrix vertically and return matrix in a new array.
      static int[][] pointReflection(int[][] f)
      Mirror a matrix using point reflection in the middle and return matrix in a new array.
      static int[][] rotateLeft(int[][] f)
      Rotate matrix 90 degrees to the left and return matrix in a new array.
      static int[][] rotateRight(int[][] f)
      Rotate matrix 90 degrees to the right and return matrix in a new array.
      static void toString(int[][] f)
      Print array to screen
